intro: Valerianella istriaca, commonly known as the Istrian sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, green leaves and white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It is valued for its edible leaves, which have a slightly sour and peppery flavor. Valerianella istriaca is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat digestive issues and as a calming herb.
